should_render.description: Whether the bar should be visible or not.
should_render.markdownDescription: Whether the bar should be visible or not.

sprite_location.description: The path to the file in the assets which contains what the bar looks like. See the [List of sprites](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/hud_render) for a list of files included by default in the mod.
sprite_location.markdownDescription: The path to the file in the assets which contains what the bar looks like. See the [List of sprites](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/hud_render) for a list of files included by default in the mod.

bar_index.description: The indexed position of the bar on the sprite to use. Please note that indexes start at `0`.
bar_index.markdownDescription: The indexed position of the bar on the sprite to use. Please note that indexes start at `0`.

icon_index.description: The indexed position of the icon on the sprite to use. Please note that indexes start at `0`.
icon_index.markdownDescription: The indexed position of the icon on the sprite to use. Please note that indexes start at `0`.

condition.description: If set (and `should_render` is true), the bar will only display when the entity with the power fulfills this condition.
condition.markdownDescription: If set (and `should_render` is true), the bar will only display when the entity with the power fulfills this condition.

inverted.description: If set to true, inverts the way the hud render process (it'll look like its value is being decreased).
inverted.markdownDescription: If set to true, inverts the way the hud render process (it'll look like its value is being decreased).

order.description: If specified, this determines the position of the HUD render when being rendered. The higher the `order` value is, the higher it is on the rendered HUD render stack.
order.markdownDescription: If specified, this determines the position of the HUD render when being rendered. The higher the `order` value is, the higher it is on the rendered HUD render stack.

type.description: [Data Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/hud_render) An [object](object.md) or [array](array.md) of [objects](object.md) used to define how a resource or cooldown bar should be rendered. !!! note If the specified HUD render is an array of objects, then the HUD render will choose the first object that is allowed to be rendered (its `should_render` field set to `true`) and its condition fulfilled (or if its `condition` field is absent) from top to bottom. The `order` value of the very first object will also be inherited by the following objects that do not have the `order` field specified. !!! caution The entity condition specified in the `condition` field is only evaluated on the client-side, therefore, using entity condition types that only work on the server-side will not work.
type.markdownDescription: [Data Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/data_types/hud_render) An [object](object.md) or [array](array.md) of [objects](object.md) used to define how a resource or cooldown bar should be rendered. !!! note If the specified HUD render is an array of objects, then the HUD render will choose the first object that is allowed to be rendered (its `should_render` field set to `true`) and its condition fulfilled (or if its `condition` field is absent) from top to bottom. The `order` value of the very first object will also be inherited by the following objects that do not have the `order` field specified. !!! caution The entity condition specified in the `condition` field is only evaluated on the client-side, therefore, using entity condition types that only work on the server-side will not work.
